Louisa H. Smith

item.title: E-values for effect modification and conservative approximations for causal interaction
item.dc:creator: Maya B. Mathur
Louisa H. Smith
Kazuki Yoshida
Peng Ding
Tyler J. VanderWeele
item.description: We provide sensitivity analyses for unmeasured confounding in estimates of effect heterogeneity and causal interaction.

item.title: International Registry of Coronavirus Exposure in Pregnancy (IRCEP) — Cohort description and methodological considerations
item.dc:creator: Sonia Hernández-Díaz
Louisa H. Smith
Camille Dollinger
Enrique F. Schisterman
Rino Bellocco
Diego F. Wyszynski
item.description: We describe a pregnancy cohort recruited and followed during the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as some challenges encountered during the process.

item.title: Multifoetal gestations mediate the effect of in vitro fertilisation (IVF) on ischaemic placental disease in autologous oocyte IVF more than donor oocyte IVF
item.dc:creator: Anna M. Modest
Louisa H. Smith
Thomas L. Toth
Ai-ris Y. Collier
Michele M. Hacker
item.description: Multifoetal gestations mediate the effect of in vitro fertilisation (IVF) on ischaemic placental disease in autologous oocyte IVF more than donor oocyte IVF

item.title: Multiple-bias sensitivity analysis using bounds
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
Maya B. Mathur
Tyler J. VanderWeele
item.description: We show that it is possible to bound the total composite bias due to unmeasured confounding, selection, and differential misclassification, and to use that bound to assess the sensitivity of a risk ratio to any combination of these biases.

item.title: Mediating to opportunity: The challenges of translating mediation estimands into policy recommendations
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
Gabriel L. Schwartz
item.description: Commenting on an article by Rudolph et al., we describe goals of mediation analysis for informing policy.

item.title: Simple sensitivity analysis for control selection bias
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
Tyler J. VanderWeele
item.description: We extend a sensitivity analysis approach for selection bias to account for poor control selection in case-control studies.

item.title: The importance of mediation in reproductive health studies
item.dc:creator: Leslie V. Farland
Katharine F. B. Correia
Laura E. Dodge
Anna M. Modest
Paige L. Williams
Louisa H. Smith
Thomas L. Toth
Michele R. Hacker
Stacey A. Missmer
item.description: We introduce the concept of mediation and provide examples that solidify understanding of mediation for valid discovery and interpretation in the field of reproductive medicine.

item.title: Selection mechanisms and their consequences: Understanding and addressing selection bias
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
item.description: Understanding the way in which a study sample relates to the target population is critical for avoiding and addressing bias. Communication about selection bias is aided by the use of causal graphs.

item.title: Mediational E-values: Approximate sensitivity analysis for unmeasured mediator-outcome confounding
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
Tyler J. VanderWeele
item.description: We show how E-values can be used and easily interpreted for sensitivity analysis in mediation.

item.title: Bounding bias due to selection
item.dc:creator: Louisa H. Smith
Tyler VanderWeele
item.description: We provide bounds for selection bias under a variety of situations.

item.title: Health issues in the industrial port zone of Marseille, France: The Fos EPSEAL community-based cross-sectional survey
